conversation.phrase: Привет! Меня зовут Кирилл. А тебя?
conversation.pr: Privet! Menya zovut Kirill. A tebya?
conversation.en: Hi! My name is Kirill. And you?

conversation.phrase: Меня зовут Максим. Очень приятно познакомиться.
conversation.pr: Menya zovut Maksim. Ochen’ priyatno poznakomit’sya.
conversation.en: My name is Maksim. Nice to meet you.

conversation.phrase: Я из Казани, но сейчас живу здесь.
conversation.pr: Ya iz Kazani, no seychas zhivu zdes’.
conversation.en: I’m from Kazan, but I live here now.

conversation.phrase: Я работаю в IT-компании. А ты?
conversation.pr: Ya rabotayu v IT-kompanii. A ty?
conversation.en: I work in an IT company. And you?

conversation.phrase: Я инженер. Мы строим жилые дома.
conversation.pr: Ya inzhener. My stroim zhilye doma.
conversation.en: I’m an engineer. We build residential houses.

conversation.phrase: Да, мне нравится. А тебе нравится твоя работа?
conversation.pr: Da, mne nravitsya. A tebe nravitsya tvoya rabota?
conversation.en: Yes, I like it. Do you like your job?

conversation.phrase: Да, очень. Мне нравится решать задачи.
conversation.pr: Da, ochen’. Mne nravitsya reshat’ zadachi.
conversation.en: Yes, very much. I like solving problems.

conversation.phrase: Я люблю бегать и кататься на велосипеде. А ты?
conversation.pr: Ya lyublyu begat’ i katat’sya na velosipede. A ty?
conversation.en: I like running and cycling. And you?

conversation.phrase: Я играю в футбол и иногда фотографирую.
conversation.pr: Ya igrayu v futbol i inogda fotografiruyu.
conversation.en: I play soccer and sometimes take photos.
Awesome! Maybe we can play together sometime?

conversationQA.phrase: Я изучаю русский язык, потому что мне нравится культура и история России.
conversationQA.pr: Ya izuchayu russkiy yazyk, potomu chto mne nravitsya kultura i istoriya Rossii.
conversationQA.en: I am learning Russian because I like Russian culture and history.

conversationQA.phrase: Как давно вы изучаете русский язык?
conversationQA.pr: Kak davno vy izuchayete russkiy yazyk?
conversationQA.en: How long have you been learning Russian?
I have been learning Russian for a year.
Do you like the Russian language?

conversationQA2-1.phrase: Да, мне очень нравится русский язык!
conversationQA2-1.pr: Da, mne ochen' nravitsya russkiy yazyk!
conversationQA2-1.en: Yes, I really like the Russian language!
How is Russian going for you?

conversationQA2-1.phrase: Русский язык сложный, но мне интересно его изучать.
conversationQA2-1.pr: Russkiy yazyk slozhnyy, no mne interesno yego izuchat'.
conversationQA2-1.en: Russian is difficult, but I find it interesting to learn.

conversationQA2-1.phrase: Какие слова или грамматика вам кажутся сложными?
conversationQA2-1.pr: Kakie slova ili grammatika vam kazhutsya slozhnymi?
conversationQA2-1.en: Which words or grammar seem difficult to you?

conversationQA2-1.phrase: Мне сложно запомнить падежи и произношение некоторых слов.
conversationQA2-1.pr: Mne slozhno zapomnit' padezhi i proiznosheniye nekotorykh slov.
conversationQA2-1.en: I find it difficult to remember cases and the pronunciation of some words.

conversationQA2.en: Do you understand what I’m saying?

conversationQA2.phrase: Да, но иногда мне нужно, чтобы говорили медленнее.
conversationQA2.pr: Da, no inogda mne nuzhno, chtoby govorili medlennee.
conversationQA2.en: Yes, but sometimes I need people to speak slower.

conversationQA2.phrase: Нет, но я бы хотел посетить Москву и Санкт-Петербург.
conversationQA2.pr: Net, no ya by khotel posetit' Moskvu i Sankt-Peterburg.
conversationQA2.en: No, but I would like to visit Moscow and Saint Petersburg.

conversationQA2.phrase: Какое русское слово вам нравится больше всего?
conversationQA2.pr: Kakoye russkoye slovo vam nravitsya bol’she vsego?
conversationQA2.en: What Russian word do you like the most?

conversationQA2.phrase: Мне нравится слово 'вдохновение'. Оно красиво звучит.
conversationQA2.pr: Mne nravitsya slovo 'vdokhnoveniye'. Ono krasivo zvuchit.
conversationQA2.en: I like the word 'inspiration' (вдохновение). It sounds beautiful.

conversationQA3.en: Do you watch movies in Russian?

conversationQA3.phrase: Да, я смотрел(а) несколько фильмов, но иногда сложно понимать речь.
conversationQA3.pr: Da, ya smotrel(a) neskol'ko fil'mov, no inogda slozhno ponimat' rech'.
conversationQA3.en: Yes, I have watched a few movies, but sometimes it's hard to understand the speech.

conversationQA3.phrase: Какой ваш любимый русский фильм или песня?
conversationQA3.pr: Kakoy vash lyubimyy russkiy fil'm ili pesnya?
conversationQA3.en: What is your favorite Russian movie or song?
I like the movie 'Brat' and the song 'Katyusha'.
What Russian dish have you tried?

conversationQA3.phrase: Я пробовал(а) борщ, блины и пельмени. Очень вкусно!
conversationQA3.pr: Ya proboval(a) borshch, bliny i pel'meni. Ochen' vkusno!
conversationQA3.en: I have tried borscht, blini, and pelmeni. Very tasty!
Do you want to visit Russia?

conversationQA3.phrase: Да, это моя мечта! Хочу увидеть Красную площадь и Байкал.
conversationQA3.pr: Da, eto moya mechta! Khochu uvidet' Krasnuyu ploshchad' i Baykal.
conversationQA3.en: Yes, it is my dream! I want to see Red Square and Lake Baikal.

Restaurant.phrase: Привет! Хочешь пойти в ресторан сегодня?
Restaurant.pr: Privet! Khochesh' poyti v restoran segodnya?
Restaurant.en: Hi! Do you want to go to a restaurant today?

Restaurant.phrase: Привет! Да, хорошая идея. Какой ресторан?
Restaurant.pr: Privet! Da, khoroshaya ideya. Kakoy restoran?
Restaurant.en: Hi! Yes, good idea. Which restaurant?

Restaurant.phrase: Отлично! Я тоже люблю итальянскую кухню.
Restaurant.pr: Otlichno! Ya tozhe lyublyu italyanskuyu kukhnyu.
Restaurant.en: Great! I also love Italian food.
Yes, perfect! Where shall we meet?

Asking Directions.en: Excuse me, where is Red Square?

Asking Directions.phrase: Красная площадь недалеко. Идите прямо, потом поверните налево.
Asking Directions.pr: Krasnaya ploshchad' nedaleko. Idite pryamo, potom povernite nalevo.
Asking Directions.en: Red Square is not far. Go straight, then turn left.
Thank you! Is it far on foot?
Great! And where is the metro here?

Asking Directions.phrase: Станция метро рядом, вот там, справа.
Asking Directions.pr: Stantsiya metro ryadom, vot tam, sprava.
Asking Directions.en: The metro station is nearby, right there on the right.
Thank you very much! You are very kind.

conversation1.en: Hello! What would you like to order?

conversation1.phrase: Я буду кофе и пирог, пожалуйста.
conversation1.pr: Ya budu kofe i pirog, pozhaluysta.
conversation1.en: I’ll have coffee and a pie, please.

course.en: I love ice cream, [[but]] it's cold now.

course.phrase: У него есть машина, [[но]] она старая.
course.pr: U nego yest' mashina, [[no]] ona staraya.
course.en: He has a car, [[but]] it is old.
Is it a cat [[or]] a dog?
[[There is]] a table in the room.

course2.en: Although he is tired, he is working.
I went, although it was late.

course2.phrase: Я не пришёл, [[потому]] что был занят.
course2.pr: Ya ne prishyol, [[potomu]] chto byl zanyat.
course2.en: I didn’t come [[because]] I was busy.
She is sleeping [[because]] she is tired.

course2.phrase: Он идёт в магазин, и я [[тоже]].
course2.pr: On idyot v magazin, i ya [[tozhe]].
course2.en: He’s going to the store, and so am I.

course2.phrase: Я люблю чай. [[Также]] я пью сок.
course2.pr: Ya lyublyu chay. [[Takzhe]] ya p'yu sok.
course2.en: I like tea. I [[also]] drink juice.

course3.en: He [[was]] on the road for three hours.
My bag [[is]] at my friend's place.

question/negations.des: Что = what. Subject question for objects.

part12.des: Present tense 'am' is omitted. 'дома' is adverbial.
'студент' is in the nominative case as subject complement.
'брат' is in the nominative case after 'это'.

part12.pr: [[S]] dvadtsat' vtorogo goda ya zhivu v Rossii.
part12.en: [[Since]] 2020 I have been living in Russia.

part12.phrase: Я не поехал, [[потому что]] был болен.
part12.pr: Ya ne poyekhal, [[potomu chto]] byl bolen.
part12.en: I didn't go because I was sick.

part12.phrase: Она дома, потому что идёт дождь.
part12.pr: Ona doma, potomu chto idyot dozhd'.
part12.en: She is at home because it is raining.
This is a gift for you.
He gave the book [[to]] a friend.
He is writing a letter [[to]] grandma.

part12.des: 'к' (to a person) uses the dative case: 'врачу'.

useful.en: I want to go to Russia.
I want to travel to Moscow.
How do you say this?
How is this correctly pronounced?
How do I order in a restaurant?

useful.phrase: Где можно сделать заказ в ресторане?
useful.pr: Gde mozhno sdelat' zakaz v restorane?
useful.en: Where do I order in a restaurant?

useful.phrase: Какое место или ресторан вы порекомендуете здесь?
useful.pr: Kakoye mesto ili restoran vy porekomenduyete zdes'?
useful.en: What is the recommended place or restaurant to eat here?
What is recommended to visit here?
What are you doing right now?
Are you busy?
Learning Russian is difficult.

useful.phrase: Я всё ещё начинающий в русском языке.
useful.pr: Ya vsyo yeshchyo nachinayushchiy v russkom yazyke.
useful.en: I am still a beginner in Russian.

useful.phrase: Ты можешь научить меня новому слову?
useful.pr: Ty mozhesh nauchit' menya novomu slovu?
useful.en: Can you teach me a new word?
Can you speak English?
I like your accent.
Do you speak any other languages?

useful.phrase: Твой английский лучше, чем мой русский.
useful.pr: Tvoy angliyskiy luchshe, chem moy russkiy.
useful.en: Your English speaking is better than my Russian speaking.
That's cool!
Your pronunciation is great.

useful.phrase: Я учу язык, потому что он звучит круто.
useful.pr: Ya uchu yazyk, potomu chto on zvuchit kruto.
useful.en: I’m learning the language because it sounds cool.

useful.phrase: Я учу язык, потому что его весело говорить.
useful.pr: Ya uchu yazyk, potomu chto yego veselo govorit'.
useful.en: I’m learning the language because it’s fun to speak.
Is this the line?
Where is the line?
What is that over there?

useful.phrase: Какой город стоит посетить в России?
useful.pr: Kakoy gorod stoit posetit' v Rossii?
useful.en: What city should I visit in Russia?

useful.phrase: Я хочу поехать в Россию в будущем.
useful.pr: Ya khochu poyekhat' v Rossiyu v budushchem.
useful.en: I want to go to Russia in the future.

useful.phrase: Есть ли конкретный сериал или фильм, который ты порекомендуешь?
useful.pr: Yest' li konkretniy serial ili film, kotoryy ty porekomenduyesh'?
useful.en: Is there a specific TV show or movie that you recommend?

ya-verb-conjugation.en: I will go to Saint Petersburg.

tbl-verb-conjugation.en: Will you be home in the evening?
Will you go to the sea?

easy-story1.en: The park is there, to the left of the store.
You're welcome! Have a good day!
Excuse me, where is the café?
The café is next to the bank.
No, not far. Five minutes on foot.

easy-story2.en: Hi! Everything is good, thank you.

easy-story2.phrase: Я был дома и смотрел фильм.
easy-story2.pr: Ya byl doma i smotrel film.
easy-story2.en: I was at home and watched a movie.
[[I]] walked with friends in the park.

phrases1.en: What are you up to today?
How’s the weather where you are?
Do you like comedies or dramas?
Do you read books in your free time?
Which book genre do you like?
Do you have a favorite author?

phrases1.phrase: Какая погода тебе нравится больше всего?
phrases1.pr: Kakaya pogoda tebe nravitsya bol'she vsego?
phrases1.en: What weather do you like most?
Do you go to the gym?
Do you prefer the sea or the mountains?

phrases1.phrase: Какой сезон тебе нравится больше всего?
phrases1.pr: Kakoy sezon tebe nravitsya bol'she vsego?
phrases1.en: Which season do you like most?
Have you ever been to Moscow?
Do you want to visit St. Petersburg?

phrases1.phrase: Ты часто смотришь видео на YouTube?
phrases1.pr: Ty chasto smotrish' video na YouTube?
phrases1.en: Do you often watch videos on YouTube?
Do you like cats or dogs?
Are you an introvert or extrovert?

phrases1.phrase: Ты пробовал какие-нибудь экстремальные виды спорта?
phrases1.pr: Ty proboval kakie-nibud' ekstremal'nye vidy sporta?
phrases1.en: Have you tried any extreme sports?
Do you often go to cafés?

phrases1.phrase: Какие приложения ты используешь чаще всего?
phrases1.pr: Kakie prilozheniya ty ispol'zuyesh' chashche vsego?
phrases1.en: Which apps do you use most?

phrases1.phrase: Ты когда-нибудь катался на велосипеде по горам?
phrases1.pr: Ty kogda-nibud' katalsya na velosipede po goram?
phrases1.en: Have you ever gone mountain biking?
Do you like traveling by train?
Do you prefer coffee or tea?
Do you prefer morning or evening?

part1.phrase: Я купил хлеб и молоко.
part1.pr: Ya kupil khleb i moloko.
part1.en: I bought bread and milk.

part1.phrase: Мы играли в футбол и баскетбол.
part1.pr: My igrali v futbol i basketbol.
part1.en: We played football and basketball.

part1.phrase: Она читала книгу и слушала музыку.
part1.pr: Ona chitala knigu i slushala muzyku.
part1.en: She was reading a book and listening to music.

part1.phrase: Я люблю чай и кофе.
part1.pr: Ya lyublyu chai i kofe.
part1.en: I like tea and coffee.

part1.phrase: Он высокий, а его брат низкий.
part1.pr: On vysokiy, a ego brat nizkiy.
part1.en: He is tall, but his brother is short.

part1.phrase: Я хочу пойти в кино, а она дома.
part1.pr: Ya khochu poyti v kino, a ona doma.
part1.en: I want to go to the cinema, but she is at home.

part1.phrase: Это яблоко красное, а то зелёное.
part1.pr: Eto yabloko krasnoye, a to zelyonoye.
part1.en: This apple is red, and that one is green.

part1.phrase: Я люблю кофе, а мой друг чай.
part1.pr: Ya lyublyu kofe, a moy drug chai.
part1.en: I like coffee, and my friend likes tea.

part1.phrase: Я хотел пойти гулять, но пошёл дождь.
part1.pr: Ya hotel poyti gulyat, no poshol dozhd.
part1.en: I wanted to go for a walk, but it rained.

part1.phrase: Он умный, но ленивый.
part1.pr: On umniy, no leniviy.
part1.en: He is smart, but lazy.

part1.phrase: Я люблю мороженое, но не шоколадное.
part1.pr: Ya lyublyu morozhenoe, no ne shokoladnoe.
part1.en: I like ice cream, but not chocolate.

part1.phrase: Мы хотели поехать на море, но не было денег.
part1.pr: My khoteli poekhat na more, no ne bylo deneg.
part1.en: We wanted to go to the sea, but had no money.

part1.phrase: Я остался дома, потому что шёл дождь.
part1.pr: Ya ostalsya doma, potomu chto shel dozhd.
part1.en: I stayed home because it was raining.

part1.phrase: Он не пришёл, потому что заболел.
part1.pr: On ne prishel, potomu chto zabolel.
part1.en: He didn’t come because he was sick.

part1.phrase: Мы не купили машину, потому что дорого.
part1.pr: My ne kupili mashinu, potomu chto dorogo.
part1.en: We didn’t buy a car because it’s expensive.

part1.phrase: Я устал, потому что работал весь день.
part1.pr: Ya ustal, potomu chto rabotal ves den'.
part1.en: I’m tired because I worked all day.

part1.phrase: Хотя он устал, он продолжал работать.
part1.pr: Khotya on ustal, on prodolzhal rabotat.
part1.en: Although he was tired, he continued working.

part1.phrase: Я пойду гулять, хотя идёт дождь.
part1.pr: Ya poydu gulyat, khotya idyot dozhd.
part1.en: I will go for a walk although it’s raining.

part1.phrase: Хотя фильм был длинный, он понравился.
part1.pr: Khotya film byl dlinnyy, on ponravilsya.
part1.en: Although the movie was long, I liked it.

part1.phrase: Хотя она маленькая, она сильная.
part1.pr: Khotya ona malen'kaya, ona sil'naya.
part1.en: Although she is small, she is strong.
part1.des: Showing contrast between size and strength.

part1.phrase: Если будет дождь, мы останемся дома.
part1.pr: Yesli budet dozhd, my ostanemsya doma.
part1.en: If it rains, we will stay home.

part1.phrase: Если ты придёшь, мы начнём.
part1.pr: Yesli ty pridyesh', my nachnyom.
part1.en: If you come, we will start.

part1.phrase: Я куплю мороженое, если у меня будет время.
part1.pr: Ya kuplyu morozhenoe, yesli u menya budet vremya.
part1.en: I’ll buy ice cream if I have time.

part1.phrase: Если он устал, пусть отдохнёт.
part1.pr: Yesli on ustal, pust' otdokhnyot.
part1.en: If he is tired, let him rest.

part2.en: The cat hid in the wardrobe.

part2.des: Shows direction or movement into a side.

part2.en: The pencil is on the table.
We will go to the exhibition.
The bird sat on the roof.
part2.des: Indicates placement on top of something.

part2.en: He writes a letter with a smile.
We did the project with the team.
She ate soup with a spoon.
He studied under a famous artist.
A letter from mom arrived today.
He ran away from the dog.
A gift from a friend was a surprise.
I bought a book for my son.
We are preparing food for the guests.

part2.phrase: Он не может жить без музыки.
part2.pr: On ne mozhet zhit bez muzyki.

part2.en: He is writing an article about history.
We read a book about space.

part3.en: I do not want to eat.

part3.phrase: Я не видел ни фильма, ни книги.
part3.pr: Ya ne videl ni fil'ma, ni knigi.
part3.en: I have seen neither the movie nor the book.

part3.phrase: Он не говорит ни по-русски, ни по-английски.
part3.pr: On ne govorit ni po-russki, ni po-angliyski.
part3.en: He speaks neither Russian nor English.

part3.phrase: Я не ел ни рыбу, ни мясо.
part3.pr: Ya ne yel ni rybu, ni myaso.
part3.en: I ate neither fish nor meat.

part3.phrase: Она не любит ни чай, ни кофе.
part3.pr: Ona ne lyubit ni chai, ni kofe.
part3.en: She likes neither tea nor coffee.

part3.des: Expresses continuation of a negative state.

part3.en: We have already completed the task.
I always drink coffee in the morning.

part3.phrase: Я никогда не был в Париже.
part3.pr: Ya nikogda ne byl v Parizhe.
part3.en: I have never been to Paris.

part4.des: Asks for the identity of a person.
Asks about the person in charge.
Asks about an object or thing.
Asks about location in the past.
Asks about the position of a place.
Asks about the location of an object.

part4.en: When will we go on vacation?
Why do we have to do this?

part4.des: Asks for reason behind an action.

part4.en: How do I get to the station?
Which movie do you want to watch?

part5.des: Asks for the identity of a person.
Asks about the person in charge.
Asks about an object or thing.
Asks about location in the past.
Asks about the position of a place.
Asks about the location of an object.

part5.en: When will we go on vacation?
Why do we have to do this?

part5.des: Asks for reason behind an action.

part5.en: How do I get to the station?
Which movie do you want to watch?

part6.des: Asks about identity of an object.
Describes the environment at this place.
Directs attention to a place farther away.
Asks about location of the listener.

part6.en: We are going to the park.

part6.des: Describes action of the group including speaker.
